ratingDefinitions.T1: The highest tier. Ubiquitously positive reports.
ratingDefinitions.T2: The second-highest tier. Some reports of trouble but is mostly good.
ratingDefinitions.T3: Middle tier. A mix of positive and negative.
ratingDefinitions.borked: Either won't start or is crucially unplayable
ratingDefinitions.bronze: Runs, but often crashes or has issues preventing from playing comfortably
ratingDefinitions.pending: Awaiting further reports before giving a rating
ratingDefinitions.platinum: Runs perfectly out of the box
ratingDefinitions.silver: Runs with minor issues, but generally is playable

contributorSettings.headline: Contributor Settings
contributorSettings.intro: Add a device to contribute reports. ProtonDB now supports storing multiple device configurations. Devices are divided into one of two types: PC or Steam Deck
contributorSettings.invalidInfo: Device details are invalid. Must be fixed to be used for contributing.
contributorSettings.notOnSteamDeck: Log into ProtonDB with a Steam Deck on Desktop Mode to add it to your profile. Disconnect any peripherals or monitors first.
contributorSettings.otherDetail1: Devices (as well as preferences) are now persisted across anywhere you login.
contributorSettings.otherDetail2: If you provide a single device, it will be automatically be applied during the contribute flow.
contributorSettings.otherDetail3: If you provide more than one, you will be prompted to select one, by its name, at the 'Setup' step.
contributorSettings.otherDetail4: Changes to your devices will not be ready until you hit Save.
contributorSettings.otherDetail5: Only the inference of your system information is ever made public, never raw Steam data.
contributorSettings.validInfo: Device details are valid and may be used for contributing.

dashboard.description1: ProtonDB's new Click Play rating is still being fine-tuned. For more information, see the [news post]({{link1}}). Tens of thousands of authors contribute the reports that power this visualization. You can too! Reports are available via ODBL license [in monthly exports]({{link2}}).
dashboard.description2: This site was created by Buck DeFore. It's an indepdendent community project unaffiliated with Valve or Steam. If you appreciate this dashboard, consider [supporting me on Patreon]({{link}}).
dashboard.headline: How many games work on Linux? On the Steam Deck?

explore.notLoggedIn: Cannot load a library without a Steam ID. Visit your [Profile]({{link}}) to add one.

gameDetails.infoNotFound: Could not acquire information for App ID: {{entry}}. This can happen if a game was removed from the store.

battlEye.explanation: This game is known to utilize [BattlEye](https://www.battleye.com). BattlEye [can be used in Linux](https://twitter.com/TheBattlEye/status/1441477816311291906), but multiplayer functionality varies depending on how the developer has implemented it.

eac.explanation: This game is known to utilize [Easy Anti-Cheat](https://www.easy.ac). EAC has [limited support for Linux](https://dev.epicgames.com/en-US/news/epic-online-services-launches-anti-cheat-support-for-linux-mac-and-steam-deck), but multiplayer functionality varies depending on how the developer has implemented it.

nativeDiscrepancy.explanation: Although this game has a Linux-native build available, Steam does not list it as having Linux support. This can happen if a game has an unofficial, unfinished, or unsupported build. You may need to [force Steam to enable Proton for the game](/help/troubleshooting-faq#how-do-i-run-a-game-with-proton-even-though-it-has-a-native-linux-version) in order to run properly.
nativeDiscrepancy.headline: Native Support

home.compatibilityScoresDescription: How's this work? Read about it on the [news post]({{link1}}). Also, you can use a bigger version on [the new Dashboard page]({{link2}}).
home.headline: Welcome to your home for crowdsourced Linux and Steam Deck game compatibility reports!

howDoIHelp.answer: Give Linux a try! If you are new, not to worry. Here is a list of guides to get started. And if you want to help Valve and Proton to improve, contribute your reports here on ProtonDB!
howDoIHelp.question: Cool! How do I help?

home.sampleGames: Here is a sample of some popular games that are officially not whitelisted yet, but have received many Platinum reports on ProtonDB

stats.gamesWorkExplanation: Have at least one Thumbs Up or Platinum (legacy) report

theImpact.answer: Steam Play now officially supports a limited but growing set of 'whitelisted' games that are deemed Proton-compatible and play on Linux. Based on ProtonDB reports, a significant number of non-whitelisted games, including many popular titles, play just as well as on Windows.
theImpact.question: The Impact

whatIsProton.answer: Proton is a new tool released by Valve Software that has been integrated with Steam Play to make playing Windows games on Linux as simple as hitting the Play button within Steam. Underneath the hood, Proton comprises other popular tools like Wine and DXVK among others that a gamer would otherwise have to install and maintain themselves. This greatly eases the burden for users to switch to Linux without having to learn the underlying systems or losing access to a large part of their library of games. Proton is still in its infancy so support is inconsistent, but regularly improving.
whatIsProton.question: What is Proton?

whatIsProtonDb.answer: The goal of ProtonDB is to gather reports from other gamers as they test games with Proton on Linux and provide aggregate scores of how well games perform. A growing pool of suggestions provides tweaks that you can try to get games working while Proton continues development. In addition to this, you may explore the Steam game catalog on this site to browse and discover a wide range of titles that were previously unavailable for use on Linux.
whatIsProtonDb.question: What is ProtonDB?

whyBigDeal.answer: The Linux desktop experience has improved by leaps and bounds in the last year or two. Most of what you may be used to on Windows or MacOS is possible on Linux without having to tinker too much, and the tinkering can even be fun. Meanwhile, more and more of our daily interactions with a computer happen online, and browsers behave much the same on Linux as they do on other operating systems. Proton and Steam Play address a significant obstacle to adoption: gaming, where until recently there was limited compatibility.
whyBigDeal.question: Why is this a big deal?

categories.deck: How it plays on the Steam Deck

explanations.borked: Either won't start or is crucially unplayable
explanations.bronze: Runs, but often crashes or has issues preventing from playing comfortably
explanations.pending: Awaiting further reports before giving a rating
explanations.platinum: Runs perfectly out of the box
explanations.silver: Runs with minor issues, but generally is playable

ratings.B: B Tier: Very good but room to improve

stats.gamesWithNOrMoreReports: Games With N Or More Reports

suggestions.headline: Ready for more?
suggestions.intro: The following games have been selected based on hours you've played, popularity, and SteamDB rating. They all lack reports and some may only need one more to get a {{siteName}} rating! You can reload for other suggestions or go to [Lack Reports]({{link}}) filter of Explore page for even more.

systemInfo.headline: System Information
systemInfo.howTo: PC: Gathering Steam information is straightforward if you have access to Steam settings on the machine where you play your games. [Go here to learn how]({{link}}). Some users have reported that they need to press Ctrl-A to select everything before right clicking. You may omit everything starting with 'LD Scout Report' or if provided it will be stripped out automatically upon saving.
systemInfo.howToSteamDeck: Steam Deck: Adding this device can currently only be done from Desktop Mode of a Steam Deck. Since devices now persist across login sessions, you only need to do this once and may author reports from another machine afterwards.
systemInfo.incorrectDeviceTypeExplanation: The system information you've provided is incompatible with this type of device.
systemInfo.intro: Reports have more utility and lend more credibility by displaying the hardware and software the game was tested on. To keep this as accurate and consistent as possible, we leverage the system information reported by Steam itself.
systemInfo.parseFailure: Parsing failed. If you are certain you copied correctly please let us know on Discord
systemInfo.pasteInstructionsChromeOs:
Paste ChromeOS system info here.

In the Settings app: About ChromeOS -> Additional Details -> Build Details (press the copy icon) -> Paste here
systemInfo.unsupportedWarning: Your system's display driver does not meet [Proton's current minimum requirements]({{link}})! You may experience crashes, slow performance, or graphical degradations. You may still submit reports and there is still value in your contributions, but your reports will show your graphics drivers in red and will not be counted toward aggregate ratings for games. Please update your drivers!
